TopicTitle: What is Your Glitchiest moment in KSP?

Articles.Content: Mine was EVA'ing from a pod and it suddenly launched me into escape velocity.

It's fairly common but parachuting down to land on Kerbin and:

1. Planet disappears in a blue dot
2. Quickly quicksave
3. Explode at landing altitude, since the planet's gone
4. Restart, Quickload
5. No/tiny parachutes
6. Explode at landing because of high descent rate

Driving an old airliner around the KSC...

Try to brake, but accidentally hit Astronaut Complex at very slow speed.

It still knocks off the cockpit and... game crash.

When I reload it the craft is nowhere to be seen.

Then I notice a single cockpit zooming out of the solar system at light speed.
Whenever I try to build space warships. My torpedoes always glitch out and rip themselves apart a few seconds after launch. Once I fired a torpedo and it came around and blew my ship in half.
my first eva's in career mode. all hell(krakens) broke loose

When I tried to use the Advanced Grabbing Unit part. *Tried*

I tried to timewarp: BOOM

I tried to move the ship: The claw part remained stationary but the rest of the ship moved, AKA BOOM

I tried to go through an SOI change: The entire ship stopped orbiting and remained stationary, even when timewarping

I tried to save the game: Error NullReferenceException

I exited to back to Space Center: The ship was not saved and was destroyed

When I reloaded the ship (after I got it to save): The asteroid wobbled and the claw broke connection

...and then the planet was destroyed

......When I mysteriously lost an entire persistense file. No kraken, the persistence file is just blank. I had done nothing to it.

Worst was when I went to a probe that I had going interplanetary and got a kraken attack that crashed the game. When I went back to KSC all my ships in Kerbin, Mun and Minmus orbits were in a bunch flying out of the solar system.

[Well...](http://www.gfycat.com/DecisiveDeadGrayling)

There was this contract, you see.

I was doing a bunch of tests to perfect a small rocket to get to the Mun. I had command modules scattered about the launchpad, plus one vehicle active on the pad itself. An astronaut left the main vehicle, and had landed on the ground, making sure that the ladders were working right, when an attempt was made to climb back onto the vehicle.

One instant they were standing at the KSC, a few minutes away from snacks and a bed. Seconds away from more than five other Kerbals. The next second, everything was dark, except the clearly distant Kerbol. It took nineteen days to hit it, and the crewman was going to fast for an intercept to be possible. At the same time, two crew members were killed instantly, and three sitting nearby were launched into Kerbol escape, with the shredded remains of a ship flying after them. It was a sad day at the KSC, and it caused a great bit of inquiry surrounding the use of ladders on spacecraft.

I've had a lot of fun with glitches over the years. But the so-called "glitchiest moment" was actually just caused by a combination of wobbly toroidal fuel tanks and infinigliders.
